department: Chinese, South and Southeast Asian Art
description: dark brown jacket with embroidered and applique sleeves; single loop closure on PL side with 9 loops on PR right side; top loop ends in cord ball; small metal balls on the remaining 8; sleeves decorated with appliqued pieces of silk felt, metallic inclusions and couched silk embroidery; primary colors red, green, dark brown and white; lined in cotton
text:
The Miao are one of China’s largest ethnic minority groups, scattered among several provinces, but mostly living in Guizhou/Yunnan plateau. They are famous for their embroidery skills and indigo dyeing techniques. Styles of Miao costume are diverse among the culture’s various sub-groups. A popular saying states “If you meet one hundred Miaos, you will see one hundred costumes.” 

Miao women combined weaving, embroidery and applique techniques to achieve the desired density of the pattern within their work. This black “short skirt” jacket bears sleeves that have been embellished using various techniques.
title: Woman's jacket
